events.title: George Washington Inaugurated as First U.S. President
events.description: George Washington took the oath of office in New York City, becoming the first President of the United States under the new Constitution.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of the United States government under the Constitution and set a precedent for peaceful transition of power.

events.title: Death of Adolf Hitler
events.description: Adolf Hitler committed suicide in his bunker in Berlin as Soviet forces closed in during World War II.
events.significance: Signaled the imminent end of Nazi Germany and World War II in Europe.

events.title: Fall of Saigon
events.description: North Vietnamese forces captured Saigon, marking the end of the Vietnam War and leading to the reunification of Vietnam under communist control.
events.significance: Ended decades of conflict in Vietnam and shifted geopolitical dynamics in Southeast Asia.

events.title: Louisiana Purchase Announced to the U.S. Senate
events.description: President Thomas Jefferson announced the Louisiana Purchase, doubling the size of the United States.
events.significance: Significantly expanded U.S. territory and paved the way for westward expansion.

events.title: Czechoslovakia Peacefully Splits into Czech Republic and Slovakia
events.description: The peaceful dissolution known as the Velvet Divorce officially took effect, creating two independent nations.
events.significance: An example of a peaceful separation of states following political and nationalistic differences.
